question: You are a SysOps Administrator for an events company that is launching a new TV show tomorrow. You are expecting that traffic to your website tomorrow will be huge. You have created an autoscaling group and have a combination of Reserved and On-demand instances ready. You are about to contact AWS support to ask them to prewarm your ELB in order to meet this demand. Typically, AWS requires 3 pieces of information. Which of the following is NOT information that AWS requires?

answers.A: The start and end dates of your expected surge in traffic.
answers.B: The expected request rate per second.
answers.C: The total size of the typical request/response that you will be handling.
